thread.title: Texas stuns Oklahoma with stellar ground game, pass rush
thread.title_full: Texas stuns Oklahoma with stellar ground game, pass rush

author:
Jimmy Burch 
jburch@star-telegram.com
title: Texas stuns Oklahoma with stellar ground game, pass rush
text:
Texas stuns Oklahoma with stellar ground game, pass rush 
Longhorns win as 17-point underdogs 
Texas produces two 100-yard rushers 
Charlies Strong says, ‘We needed this’ Hassan Ridgeway, on ground, and Poona Ford combine for one of the season-high six sacks Texas had against Oklahoma quarterback Baker Mayfield during the Longhorns’ 24-17 upset victory Saturday. Brandon Wade Star-Telegram Texas head coach Charlie Strong celebrates with the Golden Hat after defeating Oklahoma 24-17 in a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Oklahoma Sooners quarterback Baker Mayfield (6) battles Texas Longhorns defensive tackle Poona Ford (95) for space during the first half of a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Texas won 24-17. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Texas head coach Charlie Strong looks on during warmups before the first half of a college football game against Oklahoma at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Oklahoma head coach Bob Stoops looks on during warmups before the first half of a college football game agaisnt Texas at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Oklahoma Sooners safety Steven Parker (10) tackles Texas Longhorns tight end Andrew Beck (47) during the first half of a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Texas won 24-17. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Oklahoma cornerback Zack Sanchez intercepts a pass intended for Texas wide receiver John Burt (1) but was flagged for holding during the first half of a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Texas kept the ball on the play. Texas won 24-17. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Texas wide receiver Marcus Johnson (7) scores a touchdown during the first half of a college football game against Oklahoma at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Texas won 24-17. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Texas quarterback Jerrod Heard (13) dives on top of his fumble as Oklahoma linebacker Jordan Evans (26) defends during the first half of a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Texas won 24-17. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Oklahoma safety Hatari Byrd (4) tackles Texas quarterback Jerrod Heard (13) during the first half of a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Texas won 24-17. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Hassan Ridgeway, on ground, and Poona Ford combine for one of the sacks Texas had against Oklahoma quarterback Baker Mayfield during the Longhorns’ 24-17 upset victory Saturday. Brandon Wade Star-Telegram Oklahoma wide receiver Sterling Shepard (3) is unable to catch a pass as Texas Longhorn linebacker Peter Jinkens (19) defends during the first half of a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Brandon Wade Special to the Star-Telegram Texas linebacker Peter Jinkens (19) and cornerback Duke Thomas, right, celebrate a tackling an Oklahoma receiver during the first half of a college football game at the Cotton Bowl in Dallas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Texas won 24-17.
